title: Meiomi 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County-Monterey County-Santa Barbara County)
description: Constellation purchased this brand in 2015 for its superripe Pinot Noir, but this balanced Chardonnay may be the key to its future. Sea salt, marcona almond and yellow pear scents show on the nose, while the palate leads with strong acidity, settling on lemon peel, subtle smoke and dried herb flavors.

title: Mi Terruño 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: A standard but appealing combination of oak, spice and berry aromas leads to a clampy tannic woody palate. This is spicy and tastes fully oaked, with plum and generic berry flavors in support. On the finish, this tastes of plum, berry and chocolate.

title: Michael David 2015 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This flavorful wine smells citrusy and lightly herbaceous, offering just enough richness on the palate to feel complete. Spicy oak aromas meet crisp apple and lightly butter flavors, making it fun to sip.

title: Migration 2014 Drum Canyon Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite reserved in aroma, this bottling from Duckhorn made with fruit from a Dierberg-owned site shows light cranberry and chaparral scents on the nose. The palate is straight-forward with tangy cranberry and cedar flavors.

title: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Atrium Malbec (Cahors)
description: While there are plenty of tannins in this wine, there is also great fruit. Blackberry and plum flavors explode in the mouth. They are backed by the serious tannins and dark texture that will allow the wine to age. Drink this bold wine from 2019.

title: Ferraton Pere et Fils 2015 Samorëns White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: This is a weighty blend of Grenache Blanc (60%) and Clairette (40%). Honeyed notes of pineapple, pear and citrus end in a mouthwatering cavalcade of fruit cocktail and a touch of citrus pith. Drink now.

title: Firestone 2013 Lineage The Chairman Series Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This hearty blend of 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 27% Cabernet Franc, 24% Merlot and 14% Petit Verdot offers blackberry, smoked beef, vanilla, cola and anise scents on the nose. The palate is tightly wound, its boysenberry fruit and dark soil minerality leading into a finish laced with licorice spice.

title: Franchetto 2015 La Capelina  (Soave)
description: This savory white opens with aromas of exotic fruit, apricot, hay and a whiff of wild flower that follow through to the palate along with grapefruit and a vegetal note. A mineral accent lifts the finish.

title: Hacormim 2014 Adi 13 Shiraz (Israel)
description: Aromas of black cherry and dark chocolate prime the palate for flavors of black cherry, black plum, mocha, smoked meat and a hint of bell pepper. It is vibrant on entry, with a sense of brightness that stands out above firm but subtle tannins.

title: Edgebaston 2013 David Finlayson Camino Africana Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: A deep gold color, this is a rich and reduced Chenin, brimming with notes of baked apple, honeydew and spiced orange tea. It's full and fleshy on the palate, boasting flavors of apple pie, orange cream and honey-roasted nuts that are partnered with just enough acidity. Drink now.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2015 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: For being one of the more widely available Chardonnays around, this vintage performs strongly against more expensive wines. Pineapple, vanilla and light caramel aromas lead the nose, while vibrant acidity kicks off the palate. Pear, Gala apple and pineapple flavors make it a reliable weeknight sipper.

title: HandCraft 2014 Artisan Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This admittedly oaky wine makes an attractive package of cedary, savory aromas and rich fruit flavors. It's playful on the nose, with rosemary and forest floor aromas, and almost-sweet Bing cherry flavors on the full-bodied and smooth palate.

title: Hobo 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Earthy leather and black pepper notes play against tart cherry and raspberry flavors in this light-bodied red blended with 8% Petite Sirah. Bright acidity supports the fruit.

title: Dominio de Punctum 2014 Dulce Venganza Late Harvest Chardonnay (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: This golden dessert Chardonnay opens with soft aromas of papaya, melon, squash and corn. On the palate, this is chunky like pineapple syrup. Flavors of pineapple, melon and mango puree end with a note of carrot on a long viscous finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2015 Viognier (Alentejano)
description: This shows the subtlest hints of the apricot character so often found in Viognier. That gives richness to contrast its crisp acidity and apple and pear flavors. The finish is long and perfumed. Drink now.

title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015 Grande Cuvée  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)
description: This wine has benefited from the warm vintage. It's ripe with attractive cherry fruit and a touch of spice from wood aging. It will be ready to drink from 2018.

title: Opta 2013 Reserva Red (Dão)
description: Aged for nine months in used and new wood, this wine is rich and smooth. Its acidity and blackberry fruit are balanced and ripe while staying crisp and tight on the mineral-laced finish. Ready to drink.

title: Painted Wolf 2015 The Den Chenin Blanc (Swartland)
description: There's a delicate hint of toasted spice that lends depth to the yellow apple and melon fruit core of this wine. The well-balanced palate offers ripe fruit flavors and medium acidity, while hints of orange peel and toast linger softly on the close. Drink now.

title: Enoport 2015 Tonel 22 Red (Douro)
description: This bold, firm wine strikes a fine balance between structure and ripe black plum fruit. It has dense tannins that indicate it needs time. A blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca, it will be ready from 2018.

title: Falchini 2015 Vigna a Solatio  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: Always a terrific value, this refreshing white has aromas of fragrant white flower, mint and orchard fruit. The straightforward palate offers crunchy Granny Smith apple, a hint of orange zest and a crisp clean finish.

title: Montecrocetta 2015 Santa Giustina  (Soave)
description: This savory white opens with aromas of acacia flower, crushed stone and citrus zest. The ripe round palate gives pear, chopped herb, baked pineapple and a flinty (almost smoky) note.

title: Recanati 2015 Marawi (Galilee)
description: Produced in Israel from an ancient native grape that grows in Palestine, this wine offers a lean lemon aroma with a faint whiff of petrol. Citrus and light floral flavors are dominated by lime-sorbet notes, and this interesting yet easy-drinking quaff leaves one with a lingering lemon tingle on the palate.

title: Red Thread Wines 2014 Estate Red (Howell Mountain)
description: This is a big, bold blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Petite Sirah and 15% Zinfandel that persists in thick, dense tannin and leather and tobacco notes. Full of juicy black fruit and subtle cinnamon and pepper, it finishes clean.

title: Masi 2015 Possessioni Serego Alighieri White (Veneto)
description: A blend of Garganega and Sauvignon, this has delicate aromas of citrus blossom and stone fruit. The aromas carry over to the savory palate along with yellow peach and papaya.

title: Robert Mondavi 2014 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This is a straightforward, lush and alluringly tart white that offers an oaky backbone of vanilla wrapped in fresh layers of fig, apple and green olive flavor.

title: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2015 Grenache Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Asian and Anjou pear aromas meet with fragrant peach blossom, honeydew and wet stone scents on the nose of this bottling, which shows strong promise for the variety in this region. The palate is richly textured, with light and bright candied red apple and kiwi flavors.

title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Alvarinho-Viognier Reserva White (Tejo)
description: A lightly toasty character shows this has been subtly aged in wood. It adds spice, a creamy texture and richness to what is already a finely balanced wine. Drink from 2018.

title: Michael David 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: Not at all a fruit bomb, this medium-bodied wine smells like salt and pepper, has lightly earthy and herbal flavors and a crisp mouthfeel. It will prove a pleasant accompaniment to your next lunch or dinner.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2013 Petite Sirah (South Coast)
description: Sweet blueberry aromas meet crushed gravel dust, mint and dark caramel on the nose of this bottling from a winery southeast of Temecula. The tannins are somewhat stiff and the acidity properly strong, presenting dried black cherry, leather and chaparral spice flavors.

title: J. Lohr 2015 Riverstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: This widely available wine is a crowd-pleasing knockout, with Gravenstein apple, browned butter, popcorn and vanilla cream scents leading the nose. The flavors are elementary Chardonnay: baked apple, seared white peach and light almond with butter touches.
